definitions.definition: the number you get when you add two or more numbers together

examples.text: The sum of 7 and 12 is 19.
Calculate the sum of the following figures.

phrases: greater, less, more, etc. than the sum of its/​the parts

definitions.definition: all of something, especially when you think that it is not very much

examples.text: This is the sum of my achievements so far.

definitions.definition: a simple problem that involves calculating numbers

examples.text: to **do a sum** in your head
I was good at sums at school.
If I've got my sums right, I should be able to afford the rent.
I did a quick sum to work out how much it would cost.
The company got its sums wrong when estimating how many customers it would attract.

definitions.definition: to be better or more effective as a group than you would think just by looking at the individual members of the group

examples.text: The team is greater than the sum of its parts.

definitions.definition: used to introduce a short statement of the main points of a discussion, speech, etc.

examples.text: In sum, we have no chance of winning the case.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin summa ‘main part, sum total’, feminine of summus ‘highest’.
